p: In a second model, using multiple drivers (Model B) we estimated the global distribution of vector population per area due to both climatic and socio-economic influences. Figure 5 shows a comparison of different driving forces for the global abundance of female adult A. aegypti, averaged over the past decade. In Figure 5A we use only climate as the driving force for vector abundance (per breeding site) using a linear scale. In Figure 5B (linear scale) and Figure 5C (log scale) (2006â€“2015) we use climate, human population, and GDPpc as the driving forces. Figure 5C overlays also the occurrence data ( 35).
